# Introduction
## Plastic pollution {.center}

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
### How much plastic? {.unnumbered}
- Ocean plastic flux: **11,000,000 Mt/y** [@reddy2020]
- Accelerating trend driven by **'business as usual'** [@oecd2022]
:::
::: {.column width="50%"}
### Where is the limit? {.unnumbered}
- Defined **9 planetary boundaries** [@rockstrom2009]
- **6/9** boundaries transgressed [@richardson2023]
- Production **outpaces safety assessment** [@persson2022]
:::
::::

## {.unnumbered .center}
### Why is plastic so threatening? {.unnumbered}

- Plastic **is persistent** and **accumulates** in the ocean.
  - Plastic bags captured on camera at **10,000 m deep** [@jamieson2022]
  - High abundance of microplastics in **Arctic deep-sea sediment** [@bergmann2017]
- Engineered remediation is unlikely to succeed [@macleod2021]

::: footer
1 Introduction
:::

---

### What are the consequences to marine life? {.unnumbered}

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
- 17% of entangled *spp.* IUCN **Red listed** [@gall2015]
- Seabirds (*Procellariiformes*) **highly vulnerable** to poisoning [@savoca2016]
- **Invasive species** dispersion on top of plastic debris [@barnes2005]
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
![](images/albatross.jpeg){width="350"}
![](images/entanglement.jpg){width="350"}
:::
::::

::: footer
1 Introduction
:::

## 'Bioplastics'
### What can be labelled as 'bio'? {.unnumbered}

- Term used for **compostable** and/or **biobased** polymers
- Standard **EN 13432** demands 90% biodegradation in less than 6 months [@eubp2023]
- Biodegradation in **industrial composting** at high temperatures [60 °C @farah2016]

::: {layout-ncol=2}
![](images/compostable.png){width="150"}
![](images/biobased.jpg){width="300"}
:::

::: footer
1 Introduction
:::

## {.unnumbered .center}
### Are they environmentally safe? {.unnumbered}

::: incremental
- Depends on polymer composition, salinity, T, microbial diversity [@lott2021]
- Many **do not degrade** at sea, e.g. PLA [@royer2023]
- **Lack of consensus** around biodegradation test methods [@lavagnolo2024]
- Environmental research falls behind leaving a **knowledge gap** [@ribba2022]
:::

::: footer
1 Introduction
:::

## Objectives of the study {.center}

- Evaluate **Ecovio®** compostable plastic biodegradability
- Develop fast (**30 days**) BOD test method [based on @tosin2012]
- Propose **DEM** as a novel statistical tool for BOD prediction [@mason2006]

::: footer
1 Introduction

# Materials and Methods

## Measuring principle {.center}
### How does biodegradation happen? {.unnumbered}

::: {.fragment}
$$
\require{mhchem}
\ce{Plastic + O2(g) ->[Microbes] Biomass + CO2 ^ + Minerals}
$$
:::

### How to quatify O~2~ consumption? {.unnumbered .fragment}

::: {.fragment}
$$\ce{CO2(aq) + 2Na^+ + 2OH^- + H2O->\\ Na2CO3v + 2H2O}$$
:::

---

Therefore, biodegradation becomes a **pressure measurement**,
$$PV = nRT \quad (V,T) \equiv const.$$

::: {.fragment}
Using **OxiTop® Control System**

:::

```{r}

library(leaflet)

leaflet(samples) |> 
  addProviderTiles("Esri.WorldImagery") |>
```

## Statistical considerations {.center}
### Which statistical test was used? {.unnumbered}
- **Two-sample t-test** between testing material and control (-C) [@mcdonald2015]
- Positive biodegradation when p-value < 0.05
- ***R*** function `stats::t.test()` [@r2025]

## {.unnumbered .center}
### How was ultimate biodegradability inferred? {.unnumbered}

Simple exponential model (**SEM**) [@hewitt1975]
$$BOD_t=BOD_u\ (1-e^{-kt})$$

::: {.fragment}
Double exponential model (**DEM**) [@mason2006]
$$BOD_t=BOD_{u1}(1-e^{-k_1t})+BOD_{u2}(1-e^{-k_2t})$$
:::

::: {.fragment}
Model selection using Akaike information criterion (**AIC**) [@portet2020]
:::

## BOD test results

::: {.panel-tabset}

### Evolution

```{r}
data |> filter(time %% 5 == 0) |>
  ggplot(aes(x = time, y = bod, color = test)) +
  geom_point(aes(shape = test), stat = "summary", fun = median) +
  geom_ribbon(aes(fill = test), show.legend = F, alpha = .3, linetype = 0,
              stat = "summary", fun.min = min, fun.max = max) +
  geom_line(aes(linetype = test), stat = "summary", fun = median) +
  facet_wrap(~ medium, scales = "free_y") +
  scale_linetype_manual(values = c("dotted", "solid", "dashed"),
                        labels = labels_test) +
  scale_color_discrete(labels = labels_test) +
  scale_shape_manual(values = c(0, 16, 1), labels = labels_test) +
  labs(x = "time (days)", y = "BOD (mg/L)")
```

### BOD~30~ (mg O~2~ L^-1^)

```{r}
options(knitr.kable.NA = "")

data |> filter(time == 30) |> group_by(medium, test) |> 
  summarize(median = median(bod), min = min(bod), max = max(bod),
            .groups = "drop") |> 
  left_join(t_tests, by = join_by(medium, test)) |> 
  mutate(
    across(c(median, min, max), \(x) round(x, 2)),
    p.value = round(p.value, 5),
  ) |> 
  mutate(
    test = fct_recode(test,
                           "(+C)" = "paper",
                           "Ecovio®" = "plastic",
                           "(-C)" = "control")
  ) |>
  knitr::kable()
```

### How do model parameters look like? {.unnumbered}

```{r}
fits_s05 <- fits |> filter(reactor == "S05")

params <- fits_s05 |> unnest(params) |>
  select(reactor, term, estimate) |>
  pivot_wider(names_from = term, values_from = estimate) |> 
  mutate(
    across(starts_with("l"), \(l) round(l, 0)),
    across(starts_with("k"), \(k) round(k, 2))
  )

fits_s05 |> unnest(data) |> ggplot(aes(time, bod)) +
  geom_line(alpha = .5) +
  geom_line(
    data = fits_s05 |> unnest(preds),
    aes(y = .fitted, color = model, linetype = model),
    linewidth = 1
  ) +
  scale_color_discrete(
    labels = c(
      "SEM" = bquote(BOD[t]==.(params$l)*(1-e^{.(params$k)*t})),
      "DEM" = bquote(BOD[t]==.(params$l1)*(1-e^{.(params$k1)*t})+
                                    .(params$l2)*(1-e^{.(params$k2)*t}))
    )
  ) +
  scale_linetype_manual(
    values = c("SEM" = "dashed", "DEM" = "solid"),
    labels = c(
      "SEM" = bquote(BOD[t]==.(params$l)*(1-e^{.(params$k)*t})),
      "DEM" = bquote(BOD[t]==.(params$l1)*(1-e^{.(params$k1)*t})+
                                    .(params$l2)*(1-e^{.(params$k2)*t}))
    )
  ) +
  labs(x = "time (days)", y = "BOD (mg/L)") +
  theme(legend.title = element_blank())
```
